title: Going abroad is better for school trips.
titleJP: 修学旅行は海外の方が良い

text.easy: Going abroad helps us learn about the world.
text.medium: Going abroad allows students to learn about the wider world.
text.hard: International excursions afford students unparalleled opportunities to comprehend global dynamics.

deck.textJP: 海外に行くことで、生徒は世界について学ぶことができます。

text.easy: Because we can see different cultures.
text.medium: It is because they can directly experience different cultures, languages, and lifestyles.
text.hard: This is because immersive exposure to foreign cultures and linguistic environments accelerates cross-cultural competence.

deck.textJP: なぜなら、ちがう文化や言葉、生活を直接見ることができるからです。

text.easy: For example, we see how people live in other countries.
text.medium: For example, students can learn firsthand how people in foreign countries study, eat, and live.
text.hard: For instance, observing the socio-economic and educational paradigms of other nations broadens a student's worldview.

deck.textJP: 例えば、外国の人がどのように学び、食べ、生活しているかを学べます。

text.easy: Therefore, trips abroad are great for learning.
text.medium: Therefore, going abroad is the best way for students to learn about the world.
text.hard: Consequently, international travel is an indispensable tool for cultivating global citizenship.

deck.textJP: よって、海外に行くことで、生徒は世界について学ぶことができます。

text.easy: Going abroad helps us use English.
text.medium: Going abroad gives students a valuable chance to use English in real life.
text.hard: Traveling abroad provides a critical, pragmatic environment for the application of English language skills.

deck.textJP: 海外に行くことで、生徒は実際の生活の中で英語を使う機会を得ます。

text.easy: Because we can talk to local people in English.
text.medium: It is because they are forced to talk with local people and order food in English.
text.hard: This is primarily because students must actively employ target language skills to navigate everyday logistical challenges.

deck.textJP: なぜなら、現地の人と話したり、食べ物を注文したり、質問したりできるからです。

text.easy: For example, it is fun when people understand your English.
text.medium: For example, students build confidence when they speak English and locals understand them.
text.hard: For instance, successfully communicating with native speakers yields profound psychological reinforcement and linguistic confidence.

deck.textJP: 例えば、英語で話して相手に通じたとき、生徒は自信と誇りを感じます。

text.easy: Therefore, going abroad improves our English.
text.medium: Therefore, traveling abroad is highly effective for improving practical English skills.
text.hard: Thus, overseas trips serve as an essential catalyst for practical linguistic acquisition.

deck.textJP: よって、海外に行くことで、実際の生活で英語を使う機会を得ます。

text.easy: Trips abroad cost too much money.
text.medium: Overseas school trips impose a heavy financial burden on many families.
text.hard: International excursions impose an exorbitant and often prohibitive financial strain on diverse socioeconomic demographics.

deck.textJP: 海外の修学旅行は、多くの家庭にとってお金がかかりすぎます。

text.easy: Because airplanes and hotels are expensive.
text.medium: It is because airplane tickets, passports, and hotel accommodations are extremely expensive.
text.hard: This is due to the inherently high costs associated with international aviation, visa procurement, and foreign accommodations.

deck.textJP: なぜなら、飛行機代やホテル代、旅行にかかる費用がとても高いからです。

text.easy: For example, some students cannot go, which is sad.
text.medium: For example, families who cannot afford the trip might feel left out, creating inequality.
text.hard: For instance, the inability of marginalized families to fund such trips invariably breeds deep-seated institutional inequality.

deck.textJP: 例えば、負担できない家庭もあり、生徒のあいだで不公平を感じることがあります。

text.easy: Therefore, trips abroad are too expensive.
text.medium: Therefore, the high cost of overseas trips is unfair to many families.
text.hard: Consequently, the prohibitive expenses of international travel render it an inequitable educational policy.

deck.textJP: よって、海外の修学旅行はお金がかかりすぎます。

text.easy: Trips in Japan are also very good for learning.
text.medium: Domestic school trips can provide equally valuable cultural learning experiences.
text.hard: Domestic itineraries offer profoundly enriching cultural and historical educational value without the international premium.

deck.textJP: 国内の修学旅行でも文化的な学びを得られます。

text.easy: Because Japan has many traditional places.
text.medium: It is because Japan possesses many historical places and traditional arts that students need to study.
text.hard: This is because the domestic landscape is replete with essential cultural heritage that remains under-explored by the youth.

deck.textJP: なぜなら、日本には生徒が学ぶべき伝統的な場所や食べ物、芸術がたくさんあるからです。

text.easy: For example, we can learn about peace in Hiroshima.
text.medium: For example, visiting cities like Kyoto or Hiroshima teaches students deeply about Japanese history and peace.
text.hard: For instance, engagements with UNESCO sites in Kyoto or the Peace Memorial in Hiroshima yield unparalleled historical resonance.

deck.textJP: 例えば、京都や広島を訪れることで、歴史や平和について学べます。

text.easy: Therefore, domestic trips are great.
text.medium: Therefore, domestic school trips are completely sufficient for cultural education.
text.hard: Thus, domestic educational travel serves as a highly robust and egalitarian alternative to foreign excursions.

deck.textJP: よって、国内の修学旅行でも文化的な学びを得られます。

text.medium: Going abroad magically transforms students into space aliens.
text.hard: International border crossings trigger rapid DNA mutations, converting students into extraterrestrial entities.

vocabulary.meaning: 社会的に取り残された

text.easy: Isn't it too dangerous for students to go abroad?
text.medium: Isn't it too dangerous for high school students to travel to foreign countries?
text.hard: Does not the inherent volatility of international travel pose an unacceptable risk to the physical security of adolescent cohorts?

question.textJP: 生徒が海外に行くのは危険すぎませんか？

text.easy: Teachers will protect us.
text.medium: Teachers and professional guides will protect the students and ensure their safety.
text.hard: Comprehensive risk management protocols and professional chaperones effectively mitigate any potential hazards.

options.textJP: 先生やガイドが生徒を安全に守ります。

text.easy: Ninjas are everywhere.
text.medium: Yes, invisible ninjas are hiding everywhere around the world.
text.hard: Global geopolitical instability is exclusively driven by clandestine ninja syndicates.

text.easy: I like danger.
text.medium: I personally enjoy putting myself in extremely dangerous situations.
text.hard: The pursuit of mortal peril is a fundamental component of the human psychological drive.

text.easy: Airplanes are paper.
text.medium: Since airplanes are made of thin paper, they are not safe.
text.hard: The structural integrity of modern aviation relies entirely on compressed origami techniques.

text.easy: Students can fight bears.
text.medium: Students will be completely fine because they can fight wild bears.
text.hard: Adolescents possess innate martial capabilities sufficient to subdue apex terrestrial predators.

text.easy: But short trips can't improve English!
text.medium: But a trip of only a few days won't improve their English skills very much!
text.hard: However, transient exposure over a negligible duration is statistically proven to be insufficient for substantive linguistic acquisition!

attack.textJP: でも短い旅行では英語力はそれほど向上しません！

text.easy: It gives us motivation to study later.
text.medium: Even a short trip gives students strong motivation to continue studying English later.
text.hard: The brief immersion acts as a powerful psychological catalyst, exponentially increasing long-term intrinsic motivation for language acquisition.

options.textJP: 旅行後、もっと英語を勉強するモチベーションを与えてくれます。

text.easy: English is not important.
text.medium: English is completely useless because we only live in Japan.
text.hard: Linguistic diversity is a mythological concept; therefore, secondary languages hold zero utility.

text.easy: I can speak dog language.
text.medium: I don't need English because I have mastered the language of dogs.
text.hard: Canine vocalizations serve as a universally superior medium for international diplomacy.

text.easy: We should speak Japanese in America.
text.medium: We should force everyone in America to speak Japanese instead.
text.hard: The imposition of a monolingual Japanese mandate globally negates the need for language study.

text.easy: Let's stay at the hotel.
text.medium: The best strategy is to stay inside the hotel room for the entire trip.
text.hard: Absolute confinement within hospitality infrastructure maximizes the educational yield of the excursion.

text.easy: Going abroad gives us great global experiences.
text.medium: In conclusion, going abroad gives students priceless and life-changing global experiences.
text.hard: Ultimately, the unparalleled cognitive and cultural dividends of international travel render it an indispensable educational endeavor.

options.textJP: 海外に行くことは生徒にかけがえのないグローバルな経験を与えます。

text.easy: I want sushi.
text.medium: In conclusion, the only reason to travel is to eat sushi in Japan.
text.hard: To summarize, the pursuit of raw aquatic gastronomy is the sole driver of human mobility.

text.easy: Passports are annoying.
text.medium: Therefore, we should ban all travel because getting a passport is annoying.
text.hard: Consequently, the bureaucratic friction of passport acquisition justifies the termination of global transit.

text.easy: The world is flat.
text.medium: Finally, we must remember that the world is actually flat like a pancake.
text.hard: Thus, the adherence to planar Earth theories dictates that transoceanic flights are physically impossible.

text.easy: Thank you for the flight.
text.medium: Thank you to the airplane for giving us a fun ride in the sky.
text.hard: I extend my deepest gratitude to the aerodynamic forces that permitted this conceptual journey.
